sen.j: 大葉子（おおばこ、生没年不詳）は、上代日本の女性。
sen.e: Oobako (date of birth and death unknown) was a Japanese woman in Jodai (mainly the Nara era).
Oobako (date of birth and death unknown) was a Japanese woman in Jodai (mainly the Nara era).
Oobako (date of birth and death unknown) was a Japanese woman in Jodai (mainly the Nara era).

sen.j: 調伊企儺（つきのいきな）の妻。
sen.e: She was the wife of TUKI no Ikina.
She was the wife of TUKI no Ikina.
She was the wife of TUKI no Ikina.
Career
Career
Career
TUKI no Ikina was from Nanba.
TUKI no Ikina was from Nanba.
TUKI no Ikina was from Nanba.

sen.j: 応神天皇の代に弩理使主という者が百済から帰化し、その曾孫弥和は顕宗天皇の代に姓 調首を賜わった。
sen.e: During the time of Emperor Ojin, 弩理使主 gave up Kudara (Baekje, Paekche) and adopted Japanese citizenship, and his great-grandchild, Hirokazu was conferred the family name, Tukino, during the time of Emperor Kenzo.
sen.cmt: 弩理使主→読み方不明弥和→Hirokazu＜定訳不明＞
sen.e: During the time of Emperor Ojin, 弩理使主 from Kudara (Baekje, Paekche) adopted Japanese citizenship, and his great-grandchild, Hirokazu was conferred the family name, Tukino, during the time of Emperor Kenzo.
sen.cmt: gave up ⇒ from に訂正しました。and を削除しました。
sen.e: During the time of Emperor Ojin, 弩理使主 from Kudara (Baekje, Paekche) adopted Japanese citizenship, and his great-grandchild, Hirokazu was conferred the family name, Tukino, during the time of Emperor Kenzo.

sen.j: 伊企儺は、その子孫で、号して調吉士。
sen.e: Ikina was the descendant of Hirokazu, and his go (title) was Tsukinokishi.
sen.cmt: 「号して調吉士」の意味がわからないため、「号（称号)は調吉士」と解釈して訳しました。調吉士→ Tsukinokishi＜定訳不明＞
sen.e: Ikina was the descendant of Hirokazu, and his go (title) was Tsukinokishi.
Ikina was the descendant of Hirokazu, and his go (title) was Tsukinokishi.

sen.j: 欽明天皇の代に新羅がまた背き、任那を亡ぼしたので、朝廷は紀男麻呂を将として問罪の師をおこし、伊企儺はこれの副将であった。
sen.e: Since Shiragi (ancient Korean kingdom) disobeyed again and destroyed Mimana during the time of Emperor Kinmei, the Imperial Court sent military forces with KI no Omaro as a shogun and Ikina as a vice-shogun to accuse Shiragi.

Since Shiragi (ancient Korean kingdom) disobeyed again and destroyed Mimana during the time of Emperor Kinmei, the Imperial Court sent military forces with KI no Omaro as a shogun and Ikina as a vice-shogun to accuse Shiragi.

Since Shiragi (ancient Korean kingdom) disobeyed again and destroyed Mimana during the time of Emperor Kinmei, the Imperial Court sent military forces with KI no Omaro as a shogun and Ikina as a vice-shogun to accuse Shiragi.

sen.j: 妻大葉子とともに軍に従い、敗れて、捕虜となった。
sen.e: Ikina followed the military with his wife, Oobako, but they were defeated and captured.
Ikina followed the military with his wife, Oobako, but they were defeated and captured.
Ikina followed the military with his wife, Oobako, but they were defeated and captured.

sen.j: 新羅の人が刀を抜いて彼に迫り、その褌を脱がせ、尻をあらわにさせ、日本のほうへ向けさせて、と叫ばせようとし、しかし伊企儺は、と叫び、殺された。
sen.e: A person of Shiragi pulled out his sword, came close to Ikina and made him take off his Fundoshi, then turned Ikina so his buttocks faced Japan and told him to call out [something], however, Ikina called out [something else] and thus he was killed.
sen.cmt: 「○○と叫ばせようとし」「しかし伊企儺は、○○と叫び」の○○の部分が消されているようなので、[something][something else]と入れて訳しました。
sen.e: A person of Shiragi pulled out his sword, came close to Ikina and made him take off his Fundoshi, then turned Ikina so his buttocks faced Japan and told him to call out [something], however, Ikina called out [something else] and thus he was killed.

A person of Shiragi pulled out his sword, came close to Ikina and made him take off his Fundoshi, then turned Ikina so his buttocks faced Japan and told him to call out [something], however, Ikina called out [something else] and thus he was killed.

sen.j: その子である舅子は父 伊企儺の屍を抱いて死んだ。
sen.e: His son 舅子 died holding Ikina's dead body.
His son 舅子 died holding Ikina's dead body.
His son 舅子 died holding Ikina's dead body.

sen.j: 大葉子は虜であったが、歌ってと。
sen.e: Oobako was captured but sang [a song].
sen.cmt: 「歌ってと。」の前に入る歌が抜けているようですが、そのまま [a song] を入れて訳しました。
sen.e: Oobako was captured but sang [a song].
Oobako was captured but sang [a song].

sen.j: 聞く者はみなこれを哀れんだ。
sen.e: All people listening to her singing felt sorry for her.
All people listening to her singing felt sorry for her.
All people listening to her singing felt sorry for her.
